From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Annu Kapoor

CinematographyAkash TiwariEdited byChandan AroraMusic byRahul BhattProductioncompanyTriyom FilmsRelease date
18 August 2023 (2023-08-18)
[1]CountryIndiaLanguageHindi
Non-Stop Dhamaal is a 2023 Indian Hindi-language comedy film produced by Triyom Films and directed by Irshad Khan. The film was released in cinemas on 18 August 2023.[2]


Synopsis[edit]
Non-Stop Dhamaal is a family entertainer set against the backdrop of the film industry. The story revolves around Satinder (Annu Kapoor), a visionary film director [3] with ambitious dreams of collaborating with renowned stars, teams up with his friend Amar (Manoj Joshi), a struggling film writer, to secure an investor for their new project. Jassu Bhai (Asrani), along with his business partner Khattri (Priyanshu Chatterjee), offers to support the film for a special reason. Meanwhile, Raju Bhangarwala (Rajpal Yadav),[4] a devoted fan of the popular actress Shreya Kapoor, navigates the streets of Mumbai, following his destiny. As the story progress their needs, dreams, and challenges, compel them to come together, embarking on a roller-coaster journey filled with confusion, emotions, and an abundance of comedy.[5]

Cast[edit]
Annu Kapoor as Satinder
Manoj Joshi  as Amar
Rajpal Yadav as Raju Bhangarwala
Asrani as Jassu Bhai
Priyanshu Chatterjee as Khatri
Vikram Kochher as Shareef
Rajesh Jais as Mr Bansal
Shreyas Talpade as Himself
Kamlesh Sawant as Inspector Gaitonde
Rajeev Nigam as Salim Tempo
Dev Sharma as Hiten
Kurush Deboo as Dilzaan Daruwala
Hemant Pandey as Film Distributor
Sheena Bajaj as Kaaya
Veronica Vanij as Shreya Kapoor
Payel Mukherjee as Film Actress
Giorgia Andriani in special number
Production[edit]
Produced under the banner of Triyom Films, produced by Suresh Gondalia and directed, story, dialogue and Lyrics   by Irshad Khan [6] and screenplay by Irshad Khan & Vikash Kumar Vishwakarma. Music is given By Rahul Bhatt and  Background Score by Anamik Chauhan. Cinematography by Akash Aditya Tiwari and editing by Chandan Arora. The film has been shot at various locations in  Mumbai. Non-Stop Dhamaal was released in screens on 18 August 2023.[7]
